Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build anywhereon the edge, on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 developers joining MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
About Our TeamsOur Sydney Internship opportunities are on our App Modernisation & Integration, Field Engineering, Replicated Storage Services, and Storage Engines teams. Please see below for a brief overview of each team!
App Modernisation & IntegrationThe MongoDB App Modernisation & Integration Team is building a suite of products that bring workloads into MongoDB and create visualisations on top of the data stored in MongoDB. The team works on many challenges, ranging from data migration to code modernisation and unlocking insights about data stored in Atlas using cutting-edge techniques like AI. Our tech stack includes Typescript, Java, Go, and NodeJS.
As an intern, you will work on an interesting full-stack project with a dedicated mentor who will help you learn the nuances of product software development. During your internship, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on a production codebase with a team committed to you having a positive experience!
Field EngineeringThe Field Engineering organization is a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team whose focus is bridging the gap between MongoDB official database products and the reality of our services organizations who are boots on the ground and often rely upon quickly created tools to assist customers with modernizing their application code and architectures. The sort of projects we work on are varied, but include a combination of research, proof of concept, and product development. Since we focus on GenAI, this includes working with LLMs, parsing tools, agentic frameworks, etc. Our tools are immediately usable, experimented on, and then refined by a broad engineering team worldwide.
As an intern, you will work on one or more of these GenAI projects with dedicated mentors who will help you learn the nuances of product software development. During your internship, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on a production codebase with a team committed to you having a positive experience!
Replicated Storage ServicesThe MongoDB Replicated Storage Services team's mission is to research and develop new algorithms for storing data, maintain a pluggable protocol for MongoDB storage engines, and provide a comprehensive framework for managing concurrent, transactional access to data stored locally within a MongoDB database instance.
Our team champions a culture of inclusivity and collaboration. As a team member, you will contribute to crafting and maintaining the different server components, connecting its query system and distributed replication system to its underlying storage engines.
Storage EnginesThe MongoDB Storage Team is building WiredTiger, a world-class open source storage engine. The WiredTiger storage engine manages how MongoDB stores data, both in-memory and on disk, and provides scalable parallel access that is leveraged by the higher layers of the MongoDB data platform stack. The Storage Team is a collaborative group working to keep MongoDB storage ahead of the most challenging customer expectations.
As an intern, you will work with and learn from a highly collaborative team of engineers while developing production-level code. Storage interns enjoy dedicated mentors, a friendly and helpful team environment, and social activities with their peers and colleagues. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhereon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
MongoDB is building the modern data platform of choice for developers looking to build applications faster and more reliably. We power some of the worlds most innovative technology products and services out of our offices worldwide, from New York to Sydney, Berlin to Dublin, and just about everywhere in between.
Were searching for a UX Researcher who is passionate about creating great, intuitive customer experiences and generating business impact. This researcher should care deeply about our customers and be driven to improving the product experience for them. The right person for this role is someone who can identify user problems, serve as an assertive advocate for the user, and facilitate a user-centered cross-products development process.
About You
As a User Experience Researcher, you will be involved in all stages of the product design lifecyclefrom identifying core user needs during the discovery phase to measuring impact on the user after a product is launched. By leveraging your broad skills in both quantitative and qualitative research, you will serve as a voice for the user and guide the user-centered design process.
You will help influence and define research processes, continuously finding opportunities to provide user insights to product teams to facilitate decision-making. You will work cross products and lead projects, working with product designers, product managers, and engineers to ensure that user needs are deeply understood by all team members. You will elevate the role of user research within MongoDB and mentor other researchers on how best to apply research to their projects or how to conduct research on their own.  
Responsibilities

Understand our users and potential users by identifying their motivations, needs, expectations, and goals
Uncover areas of opportunity and identify actionable ways to improve the user experience of MongoDB products and services
Work closely with stakeholders to clearly define research problems, distilling technically complex requirements into actionable research plans
Ability to formulate specific, answerable, and practical questions, with the underlying desire to understand the why" and how
Collect and analyze data through a wide array UX research methods including, but not limited to: field studies, surveys, competitive analyses, user interviews, card sorting, and live A/B testing
Translate research findings into actionable insights for diverse audiences, including product designers, product managers, engineers, and C-level executives
Serve as a subject matter expert on a portfolio of MongoDB products
Facilitate ideation sessions with product stakeholders

Qualifications

Undergraduate Degree in Psychology, Cognitive Science, Anthropology, Human Factors, HCI/CS or a related field
Well-versed in a variety of user research methods, and comfortable working with both qualitative and quantitative data
Demonstrate working knowledge of study design, qualitative and quantitative user research best practices, and experimental design
Superior communication skills and storytelling ability. You can properly contextualize research insights and articulate your thoughts clearly
Empathetic, communicative, creative problem solver, and a passionate user advocate
2+ years of experience
